intro: Cestichis taiwaniana, commonly known as the Taiwan cestichis, is a rare flowering plant native to Taiwan. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and slender stems. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments, often found in mountainous regions. Its leaves are ovate to elliptical in shape, with a smooth surface and a slightly waxy texture. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a valuable species for botanical research and conservation efforts.
